intro: Cleome serrulata f. inornata, commonly known as the smooth cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation. The varietal form 'inornata' is distinguished by its smoother, less hairy foliage compared to the typical form.
